page.title: 06THE PUBLIC IN AWBRIDGE
page.content: Four of the fourth year pupils went out to interview the public in{ {Awbridge.} They interviewed four people all of whom had lived in{Awbridge}for at least five years. Most people used the village hall as a meeting place. One man noticed that when he first came to live in the village everybody worked on the farms. Now most people work away from the village. One woman thought that there were too many cars speeding through the village and that there should be more speed limits. A man thought village life should be compact but it isn't. Someone noticed an increase of houses meaning more people coming to live in the villlage. Nobody wanted the village to change in the future and most people had no worries.
